features.name: Fast Movement
features.desc: A barbarian's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than the norm for her {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by +10 feet. This benefit applies only when she is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the barbarian's speed because of any load carried or armor worn. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the barbarian's land speed.

features.name: Rage
features.desc:
A barbarian can call upon inner reserves of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g} and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a barbarian can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution, such as that gained from bear's endurance, do not increase the total number of rounds that a barbarian can rage per day. A barbarian can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, a barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes damage, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, a barbarian cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
A barbarian can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. A barbarian can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If a barbarian falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.

features.name: Barbarian Proficiencies
features.desc: A barbarian is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Rage Power
features.desc: As a barbarian gains levels, she learns to use her rage in new ways. Starting at 2nd level, a barbarian gains a rage power. She gains another rage power for every two levels of barbarian attained after 2nd level. A barbarian gains the benefits of rage powers only while raging, and some of these powers require the barbarian to take an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} first. Unless otherwise noted, a barbarian cannot select an individual power more than once.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}, nor does she lose her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} if the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A character with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against her.
If a character already has uncanny dodge from a different class, she automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead.

features.name: Danger Sense
features.desc: At 3rd level, a barbarian gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).

features.name: Improved Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can no longer be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
This defense denies another rogue the ability to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} the character by flanking her, unless the attacker has at least four more rogue levels than the target does.

features.name: Damage Reduction
features.desc: At 7th level, a barbarian gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Subtract 1 from the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the barbarian takes each time she is dealt damage from a weapon or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}. At 10th level, and every three barbarian levels thereafter (13th, 16th, and 19th level), this damage reduction rises by 1 point. Damage reduction can reduce damage to 0 but not below 0.

features.name: Greater Rage
features.desc: At 11th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +3. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 3 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.

features.name: Indomitable Will
features.desc: While in rage, a barbarian of 14th level or higher gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g}. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves she also receives during her rage.

features.name: Tireless Rage
features.desc: Starting at 17th level, a barbarian no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.

features.name: Mighty Rage
features.desc: At 20th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.

features.name: Indomitable Stance
features.desc: An armored hulk gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} and to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, and on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against trample {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. She also gains a +1 bonus to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against charge attacks and on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against charging creatures.

features.name: Armored Swiftness
features.desc: At 2nd level, an armored hulk moves 5 feet faster than normal in medium and heavy armor.

features.name: Improved Armored Swiftness
features.desc: At 5th level, an armored hulk moves faster in medium and heavy armor. When wearing medium or heavy armor, an armored hulk can move 10 feet faster than normal, to a maximum of her {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.

features.name: Pack Tactics
features.desc: At 2nd level, a mad dog and her war beast gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} while {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same opponent (instead of the normal +2 bonus).

features.name: Ferocious Trip
features.desc:
At 5th level, a mad dog's war beast gains Trip as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Trip: This feat gives the character an ability to perform the trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to trip your opponent in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. If your combat maneuver is successful, the target is knocked prone.
If the target has more than two legs, add +2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} for each additional leg it has. Some creatures — such as oozes, creatures without legs, and flying creatures — cannot be tripped.

features.name: Throat Cutter
features.desc: At 14th level, whenever her war beast succeeds at a bull rush, overrun, or trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against an opponent {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened{/g} by the mad dog, a mad dog can take an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against that opponent.

features.name: Armor Proficiency (Heavy Armor)
features.desc: You become proficient with Heavy Armor.

features.name: War Beast
features.desc: At 1st level, a mad dog gains the service of an animal companion, using the barbarian's level as her effective druid level.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Resilience of Steel
features.desc: At 3rd level, an armored hulk is able to use her armor to help avoid deadly hits. While wearing heavy armor, she gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} that applies only on {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 every 3 levels beyond 3rd (maximum +6 at 18th level).

features.name: Damage Reduction
features.desc: At 10th level, a mad dog gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 13th level and every 3 barbarian levels thereafter, this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction rises by 1, to a maximum of DR 4/— at 19th level. A mad dog's war beast gains the same damage reduction as the mad dog.

features.name: Damage Reduction
features.desc: At 2nd level, the invulnerable rager gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}/— equal to half her barbarian level. {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}Damage{/g} reduction can reduce damage to 0 but not below 0.

features.name: Extreme Endurance
features.desc: At 3rd level, the invulnerable rager gains 1 point of fire resistance and 1 point of cold resistance. At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, these resistances increase by 1 point (up to 6 points at 18th level).

features.name: Savage Rapport
features.desc: Beastkin berserker adds half her level (minimum 1) on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (when used to intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

features.name: Feral Transformation I
features.desc: At 4th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Medium wolf. This functions as beast shape I, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.

features.name: Feral Transformation II
features.desc: At 8th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Medium leopard. This functions as beast shape II, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.

features.name: Feral Transformation III
features.desc: At 12th level, when entering a rage, a beastkin berserker can take the form of a Large bear. This functions as beast shape III, except the duration is for as long as the beastkin berserker rages.

features.name: Bonus Feat
features.desc: At 2nd level and every 4 levels thereafter, the pack rager can take a bonus teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. This teamwork feat must also be a combat feat.

features.name: Raging Tactician
features.desc:
At 7th level, while a pack rager is raging, she grants a single teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} she has to all allies within 50 feet who can see and hear her. She chooses the feat at the start of the rage, and cannot change it during the rage. An ally who moves more than 50 feet away from the raging pack rager loses access to the feat, but regains it again each time he moves back within 50 feet of the raging pack rager. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.
At 13th level, the pack rager chooses two teamwork feats when she enters a rage, and grants her allies the use of both of those feats when they are within 50 feet of her.
At 19th level, the pack rager chooses three teamwork feats when she enters a rage, and grants her allies the use of all three feats when they are within 50 feet of her.

features.name: Focused Rage
features.desc:
An instinctual warrior can call upon inner reserves of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g} and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, an instinctual warrior can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Wisdom do not increase the total number of rounds that an instinctual warrior can rage per day. An instinctual warrior can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, an instinctual warrior gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and Wisdom. In addition, she gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, an instinctual warrior cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
An instinctual warrior can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. An instinctual warrior can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If an instinctual warrior falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.

features.name: Instinctual Warrior Proficiencies
features.desc: An instinctual warrior is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Fervent Reflexes
features.desc: An instinctual warrior adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

features.name: Cunning Elusion
features.desc: When unarmored and not wielding a shield, the instinctual warrior adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, an instinctual warrior gains a +1 bonus to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four barbarian levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.

features.name: Rage Power (Instinctual Warrior)
features.desc:
As an instinctual warrior gains levels, she learns to use her rage in new ways. Starting at 4 level, an instinctual warrior gains a rage power. She gains another rage power on 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, 18th and 20th levels. An instinctual warrior gains the benefits of rage powers only while raging, and some of these powers require the instinctual warrior to take an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} first. Unless otherwise noted, an instinctual warrior cannot select an individual power more than once.
She also can take additional abilities as rage power which work when an instinctual warrior rages. These abilities are: Diamond Soul, Diamond Body, Deflect Arrows, Perfect Self and Purity of Body.

features.name: Blind Fight
features.desc:
In melee, every time you miss because of {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}, you can {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit.
An invisible {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee. That is, you don't lose your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible. The invisible attacker's bonuses do still apply for {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}, however. You also gain immunity to gaze attacks.

features.name: Improved Blind Fight
features.desc: Your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} ignore the miss chance for less than total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}. You may still {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} your miss chance percentile roll for total concealment. If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} within 30 feet, that attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you with {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}. That is, you don't lose your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible.

features.name: Greater Focused Rage
features.desc: At 11th level, a instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} while raging increases to +3. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a focused rage increases to 3 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}hit die{/g}.

features.name: Greater Blind Fight
features.desc:
Your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} ignore the miss chance for less than total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}, and you treat opponents with total concealment as if they had normal concealment (20% miss chance instead of 50%). You may still {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} a miss chance percentile roll as normal.
If you successfully pinpoint an invisible or hidden {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g}, that attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you with {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}, regardless of the range. That is, you don't lose your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, and the attacker doesn't get the usual +2 bonus for being invisible.

features.name: Tireless Focused Rage
features.desc: Starting at 17th level, an instinctual warrior no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.

features.name: Unparalleled Senses
features.desc: The extremely developed sixth sense of the instinctual warrior allows him to have a blindsense to a range of 30 feet, blindsight to a range of 15 feet.

features.name: Mighty Focused Rage
features.desc: At 20th level, an instinctual warrior's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a focused rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.

name: Barbarian
desc: Barbarians excel in combat, possessing the martial prowess and fortitude to take on foes seemingly far superior to themselves. With rage granting them boldness and daring beyond that of most other warriors, barbarians charge furiously into battle and ruin all who would stand in their way.

archetypes.name: Armored Hulk
archetypes.desc: Some barbarians disdain the hides and leather used as armor by most of their kin. Instead they master the heaviest of armors, even those created by more civilized people, to gain greater protection and stability in battle.

archetypes.name: Mad Dog
archetypes.desc: Though named for the wild savages who fight alongside rabid dogs, mad dogs employ all manner of beasts as their battle brethren.

archetypes.name: Invulnerable Rager
archetypes.desc: Some barbarians learn to take whatever comes their way, shrugging off mortal wounds with ease. These barbarians invite their enemies to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} them, and use pain to fuel their rage.

archetypes.name: Beastkin Berserker
archetypes.desc: While some barbarians take on bestial aspects in their rages, the beastkin berserker descends so deeply into primal fury that she actually transforms into an animal. Berserkers of the surface world often associate with predators such as bears or wolves, and are sometimes mistaken for lycanthropes. Some barbarians shapechange into rampaging dinosaurs or megafauna, crafting their armor out of the hide and bones of their favored animals.

archetypes.name: Pack Rager
archetypes.desc: Barbarian rages can be a thing of savage beauty, exhibiting a lethal grace. While such uncontrolled displays of carnage often disregard group tactics, there are those barbarians whose rages inspire and spur on their allies during the ferocious dance of {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}.

archetypes.name: Instinctual Warrior
archetypes.desc: Some people consider barbarians savages driven by rage and animal instincts. Instinctual warriors represent the opposite picture. They are {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentrated{/g} fighters who are so adept at controlling their rage that they can fight blind, relying on only a sixth sense.
